diagnosis.score_summary: The brand is suffering from a severe identity fracture: The Website is a 'Hype Beast' screaming about Cardi B and price rollbacks, while the Amazon presence is a 'Clinical Authority' whispering about ceramides and redness. You are effectively running two different companies—one selling viral entertainment (WWW) and one selling medical utility (PDP).

truth_1.headline: The TikToker vs. The Pharmacist
truth_1.gap_description: The WWW channels 'The Trendsetter,' relying on Cardi B, slang, and affectionate energy. The PDP channels 'The Reliable Expert,' relying on clinical stats, dryness, and distant authority. You are trying to be a 'Bestie' on your site and a 'Doctor' on Amazon.
truth_1.evidence: WWW: 'Cardi B's Pick', Warmth 4/5 (Friend) vs. PDP: '#1 Best Seller', Warmth 2/5 (Specialist)
truth_1.why_matters: This personality split creates a trust vacuum. Users who find you via TikTok expect fun and find a boring Amazon page; users who find you on Amazon expect science and find a loud website.
truth_1.the_hard_choice: You are caught between two profitable but conflicting identities: the viral friend and the clinical savior. The data demands a choice: either strip the 'Hype' from the website to secure the long-term medical prestige (Option A), or inject the 'Pop' into the Amazon listing to ride the short-term viral wave (Option B). You cannot be a clown and a clinician at the same time.

truth_2.headline: Hype Beast vs. Clinical Authority
truth_2.gap_description: WWW screams with 'The Hype Beast' voice—all caps, exclamation marks, and urgency. PDP speaks with 'The Clinical Authority' voice—measured, academic, and dry. One sounds like a clearance sale; the other sounds like a prescription.
truth_2.evidence: WWW: 'MSRP ROLLBACK!', Enthusiasm 5/5 vs. PDP: 'Functions as primer...', Enthusiasm 2/5
truth_2.why_matters: Tone is the first signal of value. The 'Rollback' screaming on WWW actively devalues the 'Medical Grade' authority you are trying to build on PDP.
truth_2.the_hard_choice: Your website sounds like a megaphone, while your Amazon listing sounds like a medical journal. This tonal dissonance is jarring. You must choose: either discipline the website copy to match the premium 'Clinical' reality (Option A), or loosen the Amazon copy to match the 'Hype' energy of your viral fame (Option B). Authority is quiet; desperation is loud.

truth_3.headline: Chaos vs. Order
truth_3.gap_description: WWW employs 'Gen-Z Pop'—disrupted layouts, stickers, and motion. PDP employs 'Pharma-Code'—rigid grids, burgundy tubes, and comparison charts. The visual physics are contradictory: one is fluid and chaotic; the other is static and ordered.
truth_3.why_matters: Visuals are processed faster than text. The disconnect makes the product look like a knock-off of itself when a user switches channels.
truth_3.the_hard_choice: You are presenting two different visual worlds. The website suggests a lifestyle accessory, while Amazon suggests a medical necessity. You must align the physics: either clean up the website to reflect the 'Pharma' structure and build trust (Option A), or disrupt the Amazon listing with 'Pop' visuals to build relevance (Option B). A brand cannot be both a party and a laboratory.

truth_4.headline: The Cheap Trap
truth_4.gap_description: WWW explicitly frames the product as a 'Rollback' commodity (The Supermarket). PDP frames it as an 'All-in-one' efficiency tool (The Pharmacy). The website is actively cheapening the perception that the PDP is trying to elevate.
truth_4.why_matters: When you lead with 'Cheap' (WWW), you erase 'Quality' (PDP). Consumers will eventually treat you as a disposable commodity rather than a skincare staple.
truth_4.the_hard_choice: Your website is treating your hero product like a bargain-bin clearance item, undermining the 'Medical Authority' you've built on Amazon. You face a strategic ultimatum: either stop the 'Rollback' screaming on WWW to protect the premium equity (Option A), or lean fully into the 'Budget Beauty' positioning globally and accept the commoditization (Option B). You cannot charge for value while shouting about price.

truth_5.headline: The Quiet Empire
truth_5.gap_description: Both channels score 100% on Key Selling Points, but PDP holds the stronger card. WWW leads with 'Cardi B' (Trends), but PDP leads with '100 Million Sold' (Legacy). The massive social proof on Amazon is a stronger authority signal than the celebrity endorsement.
truth_5.evidence: PDP Validator: '100 Million Sold' > WWW Validator: 'Cardi B'
truth_5.why_matters: '100 Million Sold' is a claim almost no other brand can make. Hiding it on Amazon while chasing TikTok fame on WWW is a strategic misfire.
truth_5.the_hard_choice: Your Amazon listing hides a nuclear weapon of authority ('100 Million Sold') that your website trades for fleeting celebrity heat. You are under-leveraging your market dominance. The choice is clear: either replace the ephemeral 'Cardi B' hero on WWW with the eternal '100 Million' stat to cement legacy status (Option A), or keep chasing the 'Newest Star' and risk fading when the trend dies (Option B). Trends fade; numbers don't.

marker_1.so_what: WWW protects healthy skin (Guardian); PDP cures sick skin (Healer). Conflicting medical promises.

marker_2.so_what: Perfect alignment on the core mission: democratizing skincare through accessible pricing and universal scope.

marker_3.so_what: Consistent 'Safety First' value set, though WWW explains it simply while PDP uses more data/charts.

marker_4.so_what: WWW positions as a 'Supermarket' commodity (Low Price); PDP positions as a 'Pharmacy' essential (Professional).

marker_5.so_what: Total disconnect. WWW is an 'Affectionate Insider' (4/5 Warmth); PDP is a 'Distant Specialist' (2/5 Warmth).

marker_6.so_what: WWW is 'The Insider' (Everyman/Jester); PDP is 'The Guardian' (Ruler/Caregiver). One wants to be your friend; the other wants to be your boss.

marker_7.so_what: WWW shouts with 'Hype' energy (5/5); PDP speaks with 'Dry' clinical precision (2/5). Major voice fracture.

marker_8.so_what: WWW uses 'Clinical Pop' (entropy/energy); PDP uses 'Pharma-Code' (grids/sterility). They look like different brands.

marker_9.so_what: Aligned on functional problem solving, though PDP focuses more on the 'Result' hook than the 'Feature' hook.

marker_10.so_what: Consistent backstory rooted in 'The Lab' and institutional expertise rather than a founder myth.

marker_11.so_what: Both channels rely heavily on 'The Fans' (Reviews/Celebs) and visual proof to sell efficacy.

marker_12.so_what: Aligned on 'Value Hacking'—delivering high performance for a low price, though WWW emphasizes the 'Low Price' more aggressively.

marker_13.so_what: Both channels are transaction-heavy 'Pitch' environments designed to convert traffic quickly.

marker_14.so_what: Both promise aesthetic perfection, but PDP claims a stronger medical 'Healing' action (4/5) compared to WWW's 'Buffering' (2/5).

marker_15.so_what: Consistent emotional delivery of 'Confidence'—the user feels capable and reassured by the product.

marker_16.so_what: WWW sells 'Relevance' (Cardi B/TikTok); PDP sells 'Rationality' (Smart Tool). Cool vs. Utility conflict.

marker_17.so_what: Both offer 'Safe Choice' belonging, but WWW implies a slightly more active social signal (Neutral) than PDP (Normalization).
